titleStmt.title: Europes wonder, or, The Turks overthrow contained in a prophecie : treating of those strange mutations yet expected, as the destruction of the Turkish Empire, the ruine of the popish hierarchy, with the conversion of the Jewes, and their restauration to their ancient inheritance in the Holy Land, and of the uuiversial [sic] reign of the Gospel of Christ upon earth : with a great victory lately obtained against the Turks, by His Majesty the King of Great Britain's Royal Navy, under the command of the Right Honourable the Lord G. Montague : the entring of the famous Port of Guienne, the taking of the strong fort of Agria & the coming of the Knights of Malta and Venecians to the assistance of the English fleet, with a brief narrative of their bloody fight, and the chief particulars thereof. / written by that famous divine Paul Grebner.
titleStmt.author: Grebner, Paul.

titleStmt.title: Europes wonder, or, The Turks overthrow contained in a prophecie : treating of those strange mutations yet expected, as the destruction of the Turkish Empire, the ruine of the popish hierarchy, with the conversion of the Jewes, and their restauration to their ancient inheritance in the Holy Land, and of the uuiversial [sic] reign of the Gospel of Christ upon earth : with a great victory lately obtained against the Turks, by His Majesty the King of Great Britain's Royal Navy, under the command of the Right Honourable the Lord G. Montague : the entring of the famous Port of Guienne, the taking of the strong fort of Agria & the coming of the Knights of Malta and Venecians to the assistance of the English fleet, with a brief narrative of their bloody fight, and the chief particulars thereof. / written by that famous divine Paul Grebner.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
